intro: Chaetothylax leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered chaetothylax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking white petals and dense, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
